item.title: Texas to Reform Tax Incentives to Accommodate Work From Home
item.description: Texas Considers Reforming Tax Incentives for Work From Home The Texas legislature is considering a bill that would reform the state’s tax incentives for companies that allow employees to work from home. The bill would require companies to count remote workers as long as they live in Texas and within 25 miles of the office.
